titleStmt.title: Discourse IV [VI AD]
titleStmt.author: Abbot Isaias, of Scete in Egypt; he flourished around 400 AD

msContents.summary: Abbot Isaias, Discourse IV: a practical exhortation to monks regarding proper behavior and overcoming of difficulties they could encounter

msItem.note: Written on the back across the fibers, the papyrus was reused; on the front there is P.Col. VIII 244
Written "transversa charta" with a single col. running the length fo the papyrus; format unusual for literary texts
47 lines of writing by a sloping, fast book hand, roughly bilinear; the hand uses a long, ornamental xi; also the large lambda and chi betray a late date
Dated on the basis of the hand and the content
The last 5 lines were crossed out by horizontal lines
On the back a sale of land in which all the people mentioned belong to Arsinoe
Punctuation by high stop followed by space in the line; one accent; occasional diaereses and word-dividers; "nomina sacra" abbreviated; a diple obelismene in the margin of line 31
The only other papyrus of the Isaian corpus (Discourse XXI) was published by Mercati in "Aegyptus" 32 (1952) 463-71; van Haelst 1221
This is the first witness of the Greek text of Discourse IV; it corresponds to the Latin version PL 40, 1115D4-1117A5
